original_content:
message_id: 173ac8267fd703a5
subject   : Subject: YOUR SURE AND STEADY ANCHOR (8-2-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 1 Aug 2020 19:11:34 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*
*We have this hope as an anchor for the soul,*
*firm and secure. (*Heb. 6:19)

*Today's Reflection:*
THE ANCHOR is an ancient Christian symbol
of hope, security and steadfastness. when the
future feels uncertain, and you are disoriented
or confused turn to this verse. Jesus is your
security. *He is an anchor for your soul.*

*Today's Prayer:*
*God, You are the Rock of my Salvation, sustain*
*and support me through fearful times.*
* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: THE ANCHOR is an ancient Christian symbol of hope, security and steadfastness. when the future feels uncertain, and you are disoriented or confused turn to this verse. Jesus is your security. He is an anchor for your soul. Today's Prayer: God, You are the Rock of my Salvation, sustain and support me through fearful times.
original_verse_text: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure.
prayer: Heavenly Father, in this world of uncertainty, we find our anchor in You. Your steadfast love and unwavering presence are the sure foundation upon which we stand. When the waves of life threaten to overwhelm us, may we find our rest and security in the hope that You provide through Your Son, Jesus Christ. Strengthen our faith, that we may cling to You as our Rock and our Salvation. Amen.
reflection: THE ANCHOR is an ancient Christian symbol of hope, security, and steadfastness. When the future feels uncertain, and you are disoriented or confused, turn to this verse. Jesus is your security. He is an anchor for your soul. Today's Prayer: God, You are the Rock of my Salvation, sustain and support me through fearful times.
subject: Your Sure and Steady Anchor
verse_text: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure.

original_content:
message_id: 173b13427c45057b
subject   : Subject: THE GRACE OF GRATITUDE (8-3-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 2 Aug 2020 17:04:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For it is by grace that you have been saved,*

*through faith—and this is not from yourselves,*

*it is the gift of God. *(Eph. 2:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

DO YOU MAKE the mistake of thinking that

if everything isn’t going your way you can’t

possibly feel gratitude for the things that are?

Gratitude is in and of itself a form of peace.

When you recognize simple blessings, you

open your heart to feel God’s presence.



*Today’s Prayer:*

Heavenly Father, thank you for the many

blessings—from sunrise to sunset—that

grace my life.

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
DO YOU MAKE the mistake of thinking that
if everything isn’t going your way you can’t
possibly feel gratitude for the things that are?
Gratitude is in and of itself a form of peace.
When you recognize simple blessings, you
open your heart to feel God’s presence.
Today’s Prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank you for the many
blessings-from sunrise to sunset-that
grace my life.
original_verse_text: For it is by grace that you have been saved, through faith-and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God.
prayer: Gracious Lord, we give thanks for the gift of Your salvation, which comes not by our own works but by Your unmerited grace. Help us to cultivate a heart of gratitude, recognizing the simple blessings that fill our days and open our eyes to Your abiding presence. May the peace of Christ rule in our hearts, that we may always rejoice in Your goodness. Amen.
reflection: Do you make the mistake of thinking that if everything isn't going your way, you can't possibly feel gratitude for the things that are? Gratitude is in and of itself a form of peace. When you recognize simple blessings, you open your heart to feel God's presence. Heavenly Father, thank you for the many blessings—from sunrise to sunset—that grace my life.
subject: The Grace of Gratitude
verse_text: For it is by grace that you have been saved, through faith-and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God.

original_content:
message_id: 173b64b68e8e0587
subject   : Subject: GROW IN CHRIST (8-4-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 3 Aug 2020 16:47:42 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*But grow in the grace and knowledge *

*of our **Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. *

*To Him be the **glory both now and *

*forever! Amen.*



*Today’s Reflection:*

SPIRITUAL GROWTH IS a lifelong

process. there is no end to your develop-

ment. The closer you grow to God, the

more you will realize how much more

there truly is! *God’s bounteous **gifts *

*are infinite.*



*Today’s Prayer:*

Our loving Father, make every day an

opportunity to nurture my relationship

with You. Amen.

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
SPIRITUAL GROWTH IS a lifelong process. there is no end to your develop ment. The closer you grow to God, the more you will realize how much more there truly is! God’s bounteous gifts are infinite.
Today’s Prayer:
Our loving Father, make every day an opportunity to nurture my relationship with You. Amen.
original_verse_text: But grow in the grace and knowledge  of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.  To Him be the glory both now and  forever!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the promise of continual growth and transformation found in Your Word. Grant us the wisdom and perseverance to press on toward the upward call, ever striving to know You more deeply and to become more like Your Son. May our lives be a testament to Your boundless grace and the inexhaustible riches of Your love. Amen.
reflection: Spiritual growth is a lifelong process. There is no end to your development. The closer you grow to God, the more you will realize how much more there truly is! God's bounteous gifts are infinite. Today's Prayer: Our loving Father, make every day an opportunity to nurture my relationship with You. Amen.
subject: Grow in Christ
verse_text: But grow in the grace and knowledge  of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.  To Him be the glory both now and  forever!

original_content:
message_id: 173bb906ef7b3399
subject   : Subject: KNOW WHEN TO SAY NO (8-5-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 4 Aug 2020 17:21:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse: *

*For God gave us a spirit not to fear *

*but of **power and love and self-control. *

(2 Tim. 1:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

KNOWING WHEN TO say no or when

to ask for help is an important part of life.

When your cup runneth over, perhaps it’s

time to say no or to look for how you might

downsize your responsibilities. When you

empty your cup of what you cannot hold,

you make room for new blessings.



*Today’s Prayer:*

Dear Lord, help me to find rest when I’m

stressed. Give me the courage to say no

and ask for help. Remind me that the best

use of my time is serving You.

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
KNOWING WHEN TO say no or when to ask for help is an important part of life. When your cup runneth over, perhaps it’s time to say no or to look for how you might downsize your responsibilities. When you empty your cup of what you cannot hold, you make room for new blessings.
Today’s Prayer:
Dear Lord, help me to find rest when I’m
stressed. Give me the courage to say no
and ask for help. Remind me that the best
use of my time is serving You.
original_verse_text: For God gave us a spirit not to fear  but of power and love and self-control.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our strength and peace come from You alone. Help us to discern when to say no and when to seek assistance, that we may make room for the blessings You have in store for us. Grant us the courage to prioritize our time and energy in service to You, that we may find true rest in Your presence. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: KNOWING WHEN TO say no or when to ask for help is an important part of life. When your cup runneth over, perhaps it’s time to say no or to look for how you might downsize your responsibilities. When you empty your cup of what you cannot hold, you make room for new blessings. Today’s Prayer: Dear Lord, help me to find rest when I’m stressed. Give me the courage to say no and ask for help. Remind me that the best use of my time is serving You.
subject: Know When to Say No
verse_text: For God gave us a spirit not to fear  but of power and love and self-control.

original_content:
message_id: 173c0a3c16f9e731
subject   : Subject: RESIST FEAR (9-6-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 5 Aug 2020 17:00:24 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“Be strong and courageous. Do not be*

*afraid or terrified because of them,*

*for the Lord your God goes with you,*

*He will never leave you nor forsake you.”*

(Deut. 31:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

HOW DO YOU react when worry enters

your mind? . What do you do when you

can’t seem to ignore or rationalize your

fear away? If this happens take a deep

breath and pray. Ask God to fill you

with His peace so that you can rest

in His presence. *Lord help me grow*

*my faith so that is guards my heart *

*and allows me to manage my*

*emotions. Amen.*

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
HOW DO YOU react when worry enters your mind? . What do you do when you can’t seem to ignore or rationalize your fear away? If this happens take a deep breath and pray.
Ask God to fill you with His peace so that you can rest
in His presence. Lord help me grow my faith so that is guards my heart and allows me to manage my emotions. Amen.
original_verse_text: Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you, He will never leave you nor forsake you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in times of worry and fear, seeking Your peace and presence. Help us to remember Your promise in Joshua 1:9, that You are with us wherever we go. Fill our hearts with the courage and strength found in Deuteronomy 31:6, that we may not be afraid or discouraged, for You are with us. Lord, grow our faith, that it may guard our hearts and allow us to manage our emotions according to Your will. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: How do you react when worry enters your mind? What do you do when you can't seem to ignore or rationalize your fear away? If this happens, take a deep breath and pray. Ask God to fill you with His peace so that you can rest in His presence. Lord, help me grow my faith so that it guards my heart and allows me to manage my emotions. Amen.
subject: Resist Fear
verse_text: Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you, He will never leave you nor forsake you.

original_content:
message_id: 173c5d43e3532bc4
subject   : Subject: DIRECT MY STEPS (8-7-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 6 Aug 2020 17:11:28 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Guard my life, for I am faithful to you; *

*save Your servant who trusts in you.*

*You are my God. *(Ps. 86:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

IT CAN BE challenging to rely on God’s

wisdom when you don’t fully understand

His ways. But when you recognize that

your human insight is not as brilliant as

God’s, you can realize your insecurities

and trust His plan. *Dear Lord, I invite*

*You to direct my steps right now. I*

*trust that You know what is best for*

*me. Amen.*

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
IT CAN BE challenging to rely on God’s
wisdom when you don’t fully understand
His ways. But when you recognize that
your human insight is not as brilliant as
God’s, you can realize your insecurities
and trust His plan. Dear Lord, I invite You to direct my steps right now. I trust that You know what is best for me. Amen.
original_verse_text: Guard my life, for I am faithful to you;  save Your servant who trusts in you. You are my God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I come before You with a humble heart, acknowledging that my understanding is limited compared to Your infinite wisdom. Help me to trust in You with all my heart and not rely on my own understanding. Guide my steps and direct my path, for I know that Your plans are far greater than anything I could imagine. May I surrender my insecurities to You, Lord, and walk confidently in the assurance of Your perfect will. Amen.
reflection: IT CAN BE challenging to rely on God's wisdom when you don't fully understand His ways. But when you recognize that your human insight is not as brilliant as God's, you can realize your insecurities and trust His plan. Dear Lord, I invite You to direct my steps right now. I trust that You know what is best for me. Amen.
subject: Direct My Steps
verse_text: Guard my life, for I am faithful to you;  save Your servant who trusts in you. You are my God.

original_content:
message_id: 173caef0930b4e53
subject   : Subject: BUILDING SANDCASTLES (8-8-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 7 Aug 2020 16:58:50 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Todays Verse:*

*On a good day, enjoy yourself; on a bad day, *

*examine you conscience. God arranges for *

*both kinds of days so that we won’t take *

*anything for granted. *(Eccl. 7:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

BUILDING SANDCASTLES is something

used as a metaphor for wasting our time.

Yet sand-castles serve as an important purpose;

they allow us to create something that we

know will not last; they encourage us to relish

the present moment.

*Dear Lord, remind me that it is never a *

*waste to be playful* *and to enjoy the day.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
BUILDING SANDCASTLES is something used as a metaphor for wasting our time. Yet sandcastles serve as an important purpose; they allow us to create something that we know will not last; they encourage us to relish the present moment.
Dear Lord, remind me that it is never a waste to be playful and to enjoy the day.
original_verse_text: On a good day, enjoy yourself; on a bad day,  examine you conscience. God arranges for  both kinds of days so that we won’t take  anything for granted.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of each day and the ability to find joy in the present moment. Help us to remember that even the most fleeting of earthly pleasures are blessings from Your hand. May we not be consumed by building sandcastles that will be swept away, but instead delight in the beauty and wonder of Your creation. In all things, may we give You the glory. Amen.
reflection: BUILDING SANDCASTLES is something used as a metaphor for wasting our time. Yet sandcastles serve as an important purpose; they allow us to create something that we know will not last; they encourage us to relish the present moment. Dear Lord, remind me that it is never a waste to be playful and to enjoy the day.
subject: Building Sandcastles
verse_text: On a good day, enjoy yourself; on a bad day,  examine you conscience. God arranges for  both kinds of days so that we won’t take  anything for granted.

original_content:
message_id: 173d03a5fc01f5ed
subject   : Subject: BE STRONG (8-9-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 8 Aug 2020 17:39:13 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*
*David also said to Solomon his son, "Be strong*
*and courageous, and do the work. Do ont be*
*afraid or discouraged, for the Lord God, my God,*
*is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you*
*until all the work for the service of the temple of*
*the Lord is finished. . ." *(I Chron. 28:20)

*Today's Reflection:*
GOD TOLD HIS people dozens of times "Be
strong." Perhaps he tells us this because He
knows asks grand things from us, but also
because He knows it can be human nature
to be discouraged. Are there big plans in your
life that you have abandoned because they
seemed too challenging? Revisit them now with
God's Word to propel you forward. *Dear Lord,*
*help me find the courage and strength to *
*carry out Your plans.*
* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text: GOD TOLD HIS people dozens of times "Be strong." Perhaps he tells us this because He knows asks grand things from us, but also because He knows it can be human nature to be discouraged. Are there big plans in your life that you have abandoned because they seemed too challenging? Revisit them now with God's Word to propel you forward. Dear Lord, help me find the courage and strength to carry out Your plans.
original_verse_text: David also said to Solomon his son, "Be strong and courageous, and do the work. Do ont be afraid or discouraged, for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you until all the work for the service of the temple of the Lord is finished. . ."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your strength and guidance. As we reflect on Your command to “be strong and courageous,“ we ask that You fill us with the unwavering faith and determination to pursue the plans You have set before us. When the challenges seem overwhelming, remind us that You are with us always, and that we need not fear, for You are our ever-present help. Empower us, Lord, to step forward with confidence, knowing that Your plans are good and Your purposes will prevail. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: God told His people dozens of times, “Be strong.“ Perhaps He tells us this because He knows He asks grand things from us, but also because He knows it can be human nature to be discouraged. Are there big plans in your life that you have abandoned because they seemed too challenging? Revisit them now with God's Word to propel you forward. Dear Lord, help me find the courage and strength to carry out Your plans.
subject: Be Strong
verse_text: David also said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and courageous, and do the work. Do ont be afraid or discouraged, for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you until all the work for the service of the temple of the Lord is finished. . .“

original_content:
message_id: 173d581df944258e
subject   : Subject: YOU ARE GOD'S INSTRUMENT (8-10-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 9 Aug 2020 18:15:25 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse: *
*Come to Christ who is the living corner-*
*stone of God's temple. He was rejected *
*by **the people but is precious to God *
*who **chose Him. *(I Pet. 2:4)

*Today's Reflection:*
We have examples throughout scriptures
of what happened to people who rejected
God's chosen. For one example look at
I Sam. Israel rejected God's judges, instead
they wanted a king and that's what they got.
that turned out to be a big mistake. We had
better began to pray for a leader of God's
choosing and pray that we don't get what
we deserve, like israel did.
*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: We have examples throughout scriptures of what happened to people who rejected God's chosen. For one example look at I Samuel, Israel rejected God's judges, instead they wanted a king and that's what they got. That turned out to be a big mistake. We had better began to pray for a leader of God's choosing and pray that we don't get what we deserve, like disraeli's did.
original_verse_text: Come to Christ who is the living corner stone of God's temple. He was rejected  by the people but is precious to God  who chose Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our ways are not always Your ways. We have seen throughout history the consequences of rejecting Your chosen leaders and instead seeking our own desires. Lord, forgive us for the times we have turned away from Your guidance and sought to have our own way. We pray that You would raise up leaders after Your own heart, who will lead us according to Your will. May we not get what we deserve, but what is pleasing in Your sight. We trust in Your perfect plan for our lives and our nation. Amen.
reflection: We have examples throughout Scripture of what happened to people who rejected God's chosen. For one example, look at 1 Samuel; Israel rejected God's judges, and instead they wanted a king, and that's what they got. That turned out to be a big mistake. We had better begin to pray for a leader of God's choosing and pray that we don't get what we deserve, like the Israelites did.
subject: You are God's Instrument
verse_text: Come to Christ who is the living corner stone of God's temple. He was rejected  by the people but is precious to God  who chose Him.

original_content:
message_id: 173daada84499165
subject   : Subject: HAVE FUN (8-11-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 10 Aug 2020 18:21:21 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*A time to laugh *(Eccl. 3:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When was the last time you had fun? When

life gets you down, lighten up and do some-

thing that brings you joy. Nurture your child-

like spirit by picking fresh flowers, or going

out for ice cream, do some-thing you love.

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: When was the last time you had fun? When life gets you down, lighten up and do some thing that brings you joy. Nurture your child like spirit by picking fresh flowers, or going out for ice cream, do something you love.
original_verse_text: A time to laugh.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of laughter and joy. In the midst of life's trials and tribulations, may we remember to nurture our spirit with the simple pleasures that delight our hearts. Help us to embrace the wisdom of Proverbs 17:22, that “a joyful heart is good medicine.“ May we find time to dance, to sing, and to celebrate the beauty of Your creation. Lord, grant us the childlike wonder to see the world through eyes of joy. Amen.
reflection: When was the last time you had fun? When life gets you down, lighten up and do something that brings you joy. Nurture your childlike spirit by picking fresh flowers, or going out for ice cream, do something you love.
subject: Have Fun
verse_text: A time to laugh.

original_content:
message_id: 173df91a8b1b9f44
subject   : Subject: REMOVE STUMBLING BLOCKS (8-12-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 11 Aug 2020 17:08:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*So if you hand or your foot causes you to sin,*

*cut it off and throw it away. It is better to enter*

*heaven crippled or lame then to be thrown into*

*the unquenchable fire with both your hands and *

*feet. *(Mt. 18:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We must remove stumbling blocks that cause

us to sin. This does not mean to cut off a part

of your body. For the church it means that any

person, program, or teaching that threatens the

spiritual growth of the body must be removed.

*For the individual, any relationship, prac-*

*tice, or activity that leads to sin should be *

*stopped. *

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
We must remove stumbling blocks that cause
us to sin. This does not mean to cut off a part
of your body. For the church it means that any
person, program, or teaching that threatens the
spiritual growth of the body must be removed.
For the individual, any relationship, prac tice, or activity that leads to sin should be stopped.
original_verse_text: So if you hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better to enter heaven crippled or lame then to be thrown into the unquenchable fire with both your hands and  feet.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging that sin is a dangerous trap that can ensnare our souls. Help us to be vigilant in removing any stumbling blocks that lead us astray, whether it be relationships, practices, or activities that pull us away from You. Give us the courage to make difficult choices, even if it means cutting off that which causes us to sin. May we cling to Your Word and the guidance of Your Spirit, that we may walk the narrow path that leads to life eternal. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: We must remove stumbling blocks that cause us to sin. This does not mean to cut off a part of your body. For the church, it means that any person, program, or teaching that threatens the spiritual growth of the body must be removed. For the individual, any relationship, practice, or activity that leads to sin should be stopped.
subject: Remove Stumbling Blocks
verse_text: So if you hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better to enter heaven crippled or lame then to be thrown into the unquenchable fire with both your hands and  feet.

original_content:
message_id: 173e4ad4a6583a77
subject   : Subject: HEAL YOUR WOUNDED SPIRIT (8-13-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 12 Aug 2020 16:57:09 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*He heals the brokenhearted and binds up *

*their wounds. *(Ps. 147:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

DOES DISAGREEMENT OR resentment

weigh on your heart? Jesus tells us to forgive

our debtors, to love our enemies and pray

for those who harm us. Follow His way with

this prayer.

*Heavenly Father, please help me to release *

*negative feelings so that I can experience *

*Your true joy.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Does disagreement or resentment weigh on your heart? Jesus tells us to forgive our debtors, to love our enemies and pray for those who harm us. Follow His way with this prayer.
Heavenly Father, please help me to release negative feelings so that I can experience Your true joy.
original_verse_text: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up  their wounds.
prayer: Gracious Lord, I come to You with a heart that is burdened by resentment and discord. Help me to heed the words of Your Son, who calls me to forgive those who have wronged me and to love even my enemies. Fill me with Your compassion, that I may pray for those who have caused me harm. Mend the brokenness in my spirit, and grant me the peace that only You can provide. Amen.
reflection: DOES DISAGREEMENT OR resentment weigh on your heart? Jesus tells us to forgive our debtors, to love our enemies and pray for those who harm us. Follow His way with this prayer. Heavenly Father, please help me to release negative feelings so that I can experience Your true joy.
subject: Heal Your Wounded Spirit
verse_text: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up  their wounds.

original_content:
message_id: 173e9d3ab04ad49b
subject   : Subject: WHEN GOD SEEMS SILENT (8-14-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 13 Aug 2020 16:57:10 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s verse:*

*To you, O Lord, I call; My rock, do not be *

*deaf to me. For if You are silent to me, I *

*will become like those who go down to *

*the pit. *(Ps. 28:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

SOMETIMES IN YOUR prayer life it might

seem as if God is quiet—that maybe He is

not present or hearing you. If this happens to

you, continue praying. Keep track of your

prayers and how you feel.

*Often you will discover that this deserted *

*period in you prayer life has brought *

*about the most beautiful blooms.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
SOMETIMES IN YOUR prayer life it might seem as if God is quiet-that maybe He is not present or hearing you. If this happens to you, continue praying. Keep track of your prayers and how you feel.
Often you will discover that this deserted period in you prayer life has brought about the most beautiful blooms.
original_verse_text: To you, O Lord, I call; My rock, do not be  deaf to me. For if You are silent to me, I  will become like those who go down to  the pit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in times of uncertainty, when it seems as though You have hidden Your face from us. We confess that our souls are often in anguish, and our hearts are troubled by the weight of our struggles. Yet, we trust in Your steadfast love and unwavering presence, even when we cannot perceive it. Lord, grant us the patience and perseverance to continue seeking You, for we know that in Your perfect timing, You will answer our cries and bring forth the most beautiful blooms from our darkest moments. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes in your prayer life, it might seem as if God is quiet—that maybe He is not present or hearing you. If this happens to you, continue praying. Keep track of your prayers and how you feel. Often you will discover that this deserted period in your prayer life has brought about the most beautiful blooms.
subject: When God Seems Silent
verse_text: To you, O Lord, I call; My rock, do not be  deaf to me. For if You are silent to me, I  will become like those who go down to  the pit.

original_content:
message_id: 173ef0691e4f222e
subject   : Subject: FULFILLING HIS PURPOSE (8-15-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 14 Aug 2020 17:10:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s verse:*

*And we know that God causes everything to *

*work together** for the god of those who *

*love **God and are called according** to *

*His purpose **for them.* (Ro. 8;28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God “works in everything” not just in

isolated incidents for our good. This

does not mean that all that happens to

us is good. Evil is prevalent in our

fallen world, but God is able to turn

every circumstance around for our

long-range good. Note that God is

not working to make us happy but

to fulfil His purpose. *Note also *

*that this promise is not for every-*

*body.** It **can **only be claimed by *

*those who love God.*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text: God “works in everything” not just in isolated incidents for our good. This does not mean that all that happens to us is good. Evil is prevalent in our fallen world, but God is able to turn every circumstance around for our long-range good. Note that God is not working to make us happy but to fulfill His purpose. Note also that this promise is not for every body. It can only be claimed by those who love God.
original_verse_text: And we know that God causes everything to  work together for the god of those who  love God and are called according to  His purpose for them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the promise found in Your Word that You work all things together for the good of those who love You and are called according to Your purpose. Even in the midst of trials, difficulties, and the prevalence of evil in this fallen world, we trust that Your sovereign hand is at work, shaping us and molding us to fulfill Your eternal plan. May we cling to the truth that nothing can separate us from Your unfailing love in Christ Jesus our Lord. We surrender ourselves to You, confident that You are working all things for our ultimate good. Amen.
reflection: God “works in everything“ not just in isolated incidents for our good. This does not mean that all that happens to us is good. Evil is prevalent in our fallen world, but God is able to turn every circumstance around for our long-range good. Note that God is not working to make us happy but to fulfill His purpose. Note also that this promise is not for everybody. It can only be claimed by those who love God.
subject: Fulfilling His Purpose
verse_text: And we know that God causes everything to  work together for the god of those who  love God and are called according to  His purpose for them.

original_content:
message_id: 173f4352ab5df492
subject   : Subject: LIVE BY GOD'S WORD (8-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 15 Aug 2020 17:19:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For the Word of God is living and active, *

*sharper than any two-edged sword, *

*piercing to the division of the soul and *

*of spirt, of joints and marrow, and dis-*

*cerning the thoughts and intentions of *

*the heart. *(Heb. 4:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

LIVE GOD’S WORD—remember the Word

of God is not simply a collection of words

from God, a vehicle for communicating ideas;

it is living, life changing as it works in us. Like

a surgeon’s knife, God’s Word reveals who

we are and what we are not. It penetrates

the core of our mortal and spiritual life.

It discerns what is within us, both good and

evil. *The demands of God’s Word require *

*decisions. We must not only listen to the *

*Word; we must also let it shape our life.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: LIVE GOD’S WORD-remember the Word of God is not simply a collection of words from God, a vehicle for communicating ideas; it is living, life changing as it works in us. Like a surgeon’s knife, God’s Word reveals who we are and what we are not. It penetrates the core of our mortal and spiritual life. It discerns what is within us, both good and evil. The demands of God’s Word require decisions. We must not only listen to the Word; we must also let it shape our life.
original_verse_text: For the Word of God is living and active,  sharper than any two-edged sword,  piercing to the division of the soul and  of spirt, of joints and marrow, and dis cerning the thoughts and intentions of  the heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the power and authority of Your living Word. May it penetrate our hearts, revealing our true selves, both the good and the evil within. Help us not merely to listen to Your Word, but to let it shape our lives and guide our decisions. May we be doers of the Word, and not hearers only, that we may be blessed in our deeds. We surrender ourselves to the transformative work of Your Spirit through the Scriptures. Amen.
reflection: LIVE GOD'S WORD - remember the Word of God is not simply a collection of words from God, a vehicle for communicating ideas; it is living, life-changing as it works in us. Like a surgeon's knife, God's Word reveals who we are and what we are not. It penetrates the core of our mortal and spiritual life. It discerns what is within us, both good and evil. The demands of God's Word require decisions. We must not only listen to the Word; we must also let it shape our life.
subject: Live by God's Word
verse_text: For the Word of God is living and active,  sharper than any two-edged sword,  piercing to the division of the soul and  of spirt, of joints and marrow, and dis cerning the thoughts and intentions of  the heart.

original_content:
message_id: 173f9a411e6e9c52
subject   : Subject: PEACE IN JESUS (8-17-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 16 Aug 2020 18:39:06 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*To everything there is a season. *(Eccl. 3:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Relationships vary with seasons and stages

of our lives. Sometimes we have control,

but often we do not. living in the moment,

appreciating what has been, and trusting

Jesus for the future is where peace lies.

*Remember, Jesus will sustain you *

*through every season.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Relationships vary with seasons and stages of our lives. Sometimes we have control, but often we do not. living in the moment, appreciating what has been, and trusting Jesus for the future is where peace lies. Remember, Jesus will sustain you through every season.
original_verse_text: To everything there is a season.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the seasons of life and the lessons they bring. Help us to find contentment in every circumstance, knowing that Your strength and grace are sufficient for us. May we trust in Your perfect timing and plan, even when we cannot see the way ahead. Guide us to live in the present, embracing the blessings of each season. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Relationships vary with seasons and stages of our lives. Sometimes we have control, but often we do not. Living in the moment, appreciating what has been, and trusting Jesus for the future is where peace lies. Remember, Jesus will sustain you through every season.
subject: Peace in Jesus
verse_text: To everything there is a season.

original_content:
message_id: 173fe7e31c6b1f40
subject   : Subject: FIRST LIGHT (8-18-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 17 Aug 2020 17:15:50 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Let the morning bring me word of Your *

*unfailing love, for I have put my trust *

*in You. Show me the way I should go,*

*for to you I entrust my life. *(Ps. 143:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

YOU CAN HEAR God at any time,

but in the above verse King David

gives a model for listening and hear-

ing Him in the morning. When you

wake, make time to allow God to

speak to you. Each day is an oppor-

tunity for you to be guided by His

instructions, His daily treasure.

*Heavenly Father, I am here I *

*am listening.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: YOU CAN HEAR God at any time, but in the above verse King David gives a model for listening and hear ing Him in the morning. When you wake, make time to allow God to speak to you. Each day is an oppor tunity for you to be guided by His instructions, His daily treasure. Heavenly Father, I am here I am listening.
original_verse_text: Let the morning bring me word of Your  unfailing love, for I have put my trust  in You. Show me the way I should go, for to you I entrust my life.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I come before You this morning, ready to listen and be guided by Your wisdom. Help me to trust in You with all my heart, and not lean on my own understanding. Direct my paths, that I may walk according to Your will. Speak to me, Lord, for Your servant is listening. Amen.
reflection: YOU CAN HEAR God at any time, but in the above verse King David gives a model for listening and hearing Him in the morning. When you wake, make time to allow God to speak to you. Each day is an opportunity for you to be guided by His instructions, His daily treasure. Heavenly Father, I am here. I am listening.
subject: First Light
verse_text: Let the morning bring me word of Your  unfailing love, for I have put my trust  in You. Show me the way I should go, for to you I entrust my life.

original_content:
message_id: 17403b91a51b2586
subject   : Subject: RIGHTEOUS DISCIPLINE (8-19-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 18 Aug 2020 17:38:17 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*No discipline seems pleasant at the *

*time, **but painful. Later on, however, *

*it produces **a harvest of righteous-*

*ness and peace for **those who have *

*been trained by it. *(Heb. 12:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

WE MAY respond to discipline in

several ways: (1) We can accept it

with resignation; (2) we can accept

it with self-pity thinking we really

don’t deserve it; (3) we can be angry

and resentful toward God: *or* (4)

we can accept it gratefully, as the

appropriate response we owe a

loving Father. *God is **not only a *

*disciplining parent but also* a

*demanding coach who pushes *

*us to our **limits and requires *

*our lives be to be **disciplined.*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text:
WE MAY respond to discipline in several ways:
(1) We can accept it with resignation; (2)
we can accept it with self-pity thinking we really don’t deserve it; (3) we can be angry and resentful toward God: or (4) we can accept it gratefully, as the appropriate response we owe a loving Father. God is not only a disciplining parent but also a demanding coach who pushes us to our limits and requires our lives be to be disciplined.
original_verse_text: No discipline seems pleasant at the  time, but painful. Later on, however,  it produces a harvest of righteous ness and peace for those who have  been trained by it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that Your discipline is a sign of Your love and care for us. Help us to respond to Your correction with humility and trust, knowing that it is meant to refine and strengthen us. May we not grow weary or lose heart, but instead, embrace the trials and tribulations as opportunities to develop endurance, character, and a hope that does not disappoint. Lord, grant us the wisdom to see Your hand at work, even in the midst of our struggles. We surrender ourselves to You, trusting that Your plans for us are good. Amen.
reflection: WE MAY respond to discipline in several ways: (1) We can accept it with resignation; (2) we can accept it with self-pity, thinking we really don't deserve it; (3) we can be angry and resentful toward God; or (4) we can accept it gratefully, as the appropriate response we owe a loving Father. God is not only a disciplining parent but also a demanding coach who pushes us to our limits and requires our lives to be disciplined.
subject: Righteous Discipline
verse_text: No discipline seems pleasant at the  time, but painful. Later on, however,  it produces a harvest of righteous ness and peace for those who have  been trained by it.

original_content:
message_id: 17408efa1d4f03fe
subject   : Subject: WHAT'S YOUR SPIRITUAL AGE (8-20-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 19 Aug 2020 17:55:56 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*But grow in the grace and knowledge *

*of our Lord** and Savior Jesus Christ. *

*To Him be the glory both now and to *

*the day of eternity. Amen. *(2 Pet. 3:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

YOUR SPIRITUAL GROWTH con-

tinues until you enter into eternity.

Regardless of your chronological

age your spiritual age depends on

your dedication to your faith. And

unlike the negative connotation of

old age, having an old spiritual age

is a precious gift!

*I say it again it should be our deep-*

*est desire to grow spiritually each *

*and every day.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
YOUR SPIRITUAL GROWTH con tinues until you enter into eternity. Regardless of your chronological age your spiritual age depends on your dedication to your faith. And unlike the negative connotation of old age, having an old spiritual age is a precious gift!
I say it again it should be our deep est desire to grow spiritually each and every day.
original_verse_text: But grow in the grace and knowledge  of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.  To Him be the glory both now and to  the day of eternity. Amen.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our spiritual growth is a lifelong journey. Help us to press on, forgetting what lies behind and straining forward to what lies ahead, that we may grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ (2 Peter 3:18). May our dedication to the faith deepen with each passing day, that we may attain the spiritual maturity You desire for us. We ask this in the name of Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: Your spiritual growth continues until you enter into eternity. Regardless of your chronological age, your spiritual age depends on your dedication to your faith. And unlike the negative connotation of old age, having an old spiritual age is a precious gift! I say it again, it should be our deepest desire to grow spiritually each and every day.
subject: What's Your Spiritual Age
verse_text: But grow in the grace and knowledge  of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.  To Him be the glory both now and to  the day of eternity. Amen.

Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*Your unfailing love is better to me then *

*life itself; How I praise You. *(Ps. 63:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Words spoken against us are among the

most painful attacks we may have to face.

If we trust God, however, these attacks

need not cause any lasting damage.

*God alone can satisfy our deepest*

* longings!*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Words spoken against us are among the
most painful attacks we may have to face.
If we trust God, however, these attacks
need not cause any lasting damage.
God alone can satisfy our deepest longings!
original_verse_text: Your unfailing love is better to me then  life itself; How I praise You.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You are the light that guides us and the strength that sustains us. When the words of others seek to diminish us, we find refuge in Your unfailing love. You alone, O Lord, can satisfy the deepest longings of our souls. Help us to trust in Your steadfast presence, that we may face the trials of this world with unwavering faith. May Your love and grace be the foundation upon which we stand, now and forever. Amen.
reflection: Words spoken against us are among the most painful attacks we may have to face. If we trust God, however, these attacks need not cause any lasting damage. God alone can satisfy our deepest longings.
subject: Sticks and Stones
verse_text: Your unfailing love is better to me then  life itself; How I praise You.

original_content:
message_id: 17412f0eafbb1798
subject   : Subject: MAKING THINGS RIGHT (8-22-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 21 Aug 2020 16:33:33 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*May the God who gives endurance and *

*encouragement give you the same attitude *

*of mind toward each other that Christ *

*Jesus had. *(Ro. 15:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Just as we take Jesus’ view on the authority

of Scripture, the nature of heaven, and the

resurrection, we are to have His attitude of

love toward other Christ-ians as well. As

we grow in faith and come to know Jesus

better, we will become more capable of

maintaining this attitude of loving unity

throughout each day. *Let us attempt to *

*grow in faith so we come to know Jesus *

*better.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Just as we take Jesus’ view on the authority of Scripture, the nature of heaven, and the resurrection, we are to have His attitude of love toward other Christ-ians as well. As we grow in faith and come to know Jesus better, we will become more capable of maintaining this attitude of loving unity throughout each day. Let us attempt to grow in faith so we come to know Jesus better.
original_verse_text: May the God who gives endurance and  encouragement give you the same attitude  of mind toward each other that Christ  Jesus had.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the example of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who emptied Himself and took on the form of a servant, that we might know Your love and grace. Grant us the same mind and attitude, that we may live in harmony with one another, united in spirit and purpose, as we grow in the knowledge of Your Son. May our lives reflect the humility and selflessness of Christ, that we may be a light to the world. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Just as we take Jesus' view on the authority of Scripture, the nature of heaven, and the resurrection, we are to have His attitude of love toward other Christians as well. As we grow in faith and come to know Jesus better, we will become more capable of maintaining this attitude of loving unity throughout each day. Let us attempt to grow in faith so we come to know Jesus better.
subject: Making Things Right
verse_text: May the God who gives endurance and  encouragement give you the same attitude  of mind toward each other that Christ  Jesus had.

original_content:
message_id: 1741867572189a36
subject   : Subject: BORN OF WATER (8-23-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 22 Aug 2020 18:01:00 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus answered, “Very truly I tell you, *

*no one c**an enter the kingdom of God *

*unless they a**re born of water and the *

*Spirit. **(Jn. 2:5)*



*Today’s Reflection:*

*Throughout the Bible* water is used as

a symbol for new life and birth. Water

washes away our mistakes and sins.

Water reminds us that there is always

a chance to start over and begin anew.

*Wash me and I will be clean.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Throughout the Bible water is used as a symbol for new life and birth. Water washes away our mistakes and sins. Water reminds us that there is always a chance to start over and begin anew. Wash me and I will be clean.
original_verse_text: Jesus answered, “Very truly I tell you,  no one c an enter the kingdom of God  unless they a re born of water and the  Spirit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that it is not by our own works, but by Your mercy and grace that we are saved. Just as water cleanses and renews, we ask that You would wash us clean, granting us the gift of new life in Christ. May we be born again through the power of Your Spirit, that we might walk in the newness of life and reflect Your love to the world. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Throughout the Bible, water is used as a symbol for new life and birth. Water washes away our mistakes and sins. Water reminds us that there is always a chance to start over and begin anew. “Wash me, and I will be clean.“
subject: Born of Water
verse_text: Jesus answered, “Very truly I tell you,  no one c an enter the kingdom of God  unless they a re born of water and the  Spirit.

original_content:
message_id: 1741d653967eacb9
subject   : Subject: COMPLETE IN CHRIST (8-24-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 23 Aug 2020 17:16:47 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*So you also are complete through your union*

*with Christ, who is the head of every ruler and*

*authority**. *(Col. 2:10)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many Bible translations use the word fullness

instead of complete. In Ephesians Paul reminds

us of the fulness we have in Christ. In Jesus,

we are filled with all good things.The fullness

of God is our re-birthright. In Him we can

be satisfied and content. *In Him we are *

*complete.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Many Bible translations use the word fullness instead of complete. In Ephesians Paul reminds us of the foulness we have in Christ. In Jesus, we are filled with all good things.The fullness of God is our re-birthright. In Him we can be satisfied and content. In Him we are complete.
original_verse_text: So you also are complete through your union with Christ, who is the head of every ruler and authority .
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for in Your Son, Jesus, we find the fullness of Your love and grace. Help us to comprehend the breadth, length, height, and depth of Your love, that we may be filled with the very fullness of You. May we rest in the knowledge that in Christ, we are complete, lacking nothing. Fill us, Lord, with Your Spirit, that we may live lives that glorify Your name. Amen.
reflection: Many Bible translations use the word “fullness“ instead of “complete.“ In Ephesians, Paul reminds us of the “fullness“ we have in Christ. In Jesus, we are filled with all good things. The fullness of God is our rebirth right. In Him, we can be satisfied and content. In Him, we are complete.
subject: Complete in Christ
verse_text: So you also are complete through your union with Christ, who is the head of every ruler and authority .

original_content:
message_id: 17422b396b29736f
subject   : Subject: GO TO THE LIGHT (8-25-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 24 Aug 2020 18:00:29 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*When Jesus spoke again to the people, *

*He said, **“I am the light of the world. *

*Who ever follows **Me will never walk *

*in darkness, but will have **the light **of *

*life.” *(Jn. 8:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When I am confused and unable to

find my way, the Lord guides and

returns me to where I belong. I trust

Jesus to give me peace. I can reach

for Him in prayer, and He leads

me back to His holy light.

*Pray for Jesus’s light to shine on *

*obstacles **your dodging as you *

*walk with Him.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: When I am confused and unable to find my way, the Lord guides and returns me to where I belong. I trust Jesus to give me peace. I can reach for Him in prayer, and He leads me back to His holy light. Pray for Jesus’s light to shine on obstacles your dodging as you walk with Him.
original_verse_text: When Jesus spoke again to the people, He said, "I am the light of the world. Who ever follows Me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of  life."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to you in gratitude, for your Son Jesus is the light of the world. When we are lost in the darkness of confusion and doubt, guide us back to the path of your truth. May your light shine brightly, dispelling the shadows that obscure our vision and leading us ever closer to your holy presence. Lord, we trust in your unwavering love and guidance, for in you, we find the peace and direction our souls long for. Amen.
reflection: When I am confused and unable to find my way, the Lord guides and returns me to where I belong. I trust Jesus to give me peace. I can reach for Him in prayer, and He leads me back to His holy light. Pray for Jesus's light to shine on obstacles you're dodging as you walk with Him.
subject: Go to the Light
verse_text: When Jesus spoke again to the people, He said, “I am the light of the world. Who ever follows Me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of  life.“

original_content:
message_id: 17431c83bf568472
subject   : Subject: PROOF OF TRUE LOVE (8-28-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 27 Aug 2020 16:17:20 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus replied, “You must love the Lord your *

*God with all your heart, and all your soul, *

*and all your mind. *(Mt. 22:37)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus has said if we truly love God and our

neighbor, we will naturally keep the com-

mandments. This is looking at God’s law

positively. Rather than worrying about all

we should not do, *we should concentrate*

*on all we can do to show our love for *

*God and others*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Jesus has said if we truly love God and our neighbor, we will naturally keep the com mandments. This is looking at God’s law positively. Rather than worrying about all we should not do, we should concentrate on all we can do to show our love for God and others
original_verse_text: Jesus replied, “You must love the Lord your  God with all your heart, and all your soul,  and all your mind.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for Your commands are not burdensome, but a reflection of Your love for us. Help us to love You with all our heart, soul, and mind, and to love our neighbors as ourselves. May our obedience to Your Word be a joyful expression of our devotion, not a heavy burden. Guide us by Your Holy Spirit, that we may walk in the way of Your commandments and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Jesus has said if we truly love God and our neighbor, we will naturally keep the commandments. This is looking at God's law positively. Rather than worrying about all we should not do, we should concentrate on all we can do to show our love for God and others.
subject: Proof of True Love
verse_text: Jesus replied, “You must love the Lord your  God with all your heart, and all your soul,  and all your mind.

original_content:
message_id: 1743740718da4d12
subject   : Subject: AN EXTRA HOUR A DAY (8-29-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 28 Aug 2020 17:46:44 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Make the most of every opportunity for doing*

*good in these evil days. *(Eph. 5:16 )



*Today’s Reflection:*

*If you ever feel—*that there is never enough time,

ask yourself if you had one extra hour today what

would you have spent it doing? Tomorrow, make

that the first thing that you get done. When you

realize that you can shift priorities and manage

time, you can begin to have more control over

how you spend your day. *Lord help me to make*

*the changes I need to make so that I feel better*

*at the end of the day.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
If you ever feel-that there is never enough time,
ask yourself if you had one extra hour today what
would you have spent it doing? Tomorrow, make
that the first thing that you get done. When you
realize that you can shift priorities and manage
time, you can begin to have more control over
how you spend your day. Lord help me to make the changes I need to make so that I feel better at the end of the day.
original_verse_text: Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil days.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that time is a precious gift, yet one that often eludes us. Help us to be wise and discerning in how we use the moments You have given us, making the most of every opportunity (Ephesians 5:16). Grant us the clarity to prioritize what truly matters, that we may walk in a manner worthy of You, redeeming the time (Colossians 4:5). Lord, guide us to make the necessary changes in our lives, that we may feel a greater sense of purpose and fulfillment at the end of each day. Amen.
reflection: If you ever feel that there is never enough time, ask yourself if you had one extra hour today, what would you have spent it doing? Tomorrow, make that the first thing that you get done. When you realize that you can shift priorities and manage time, you can begin to have more control over how you spend your day. Lord, help me to make the changes I need to make so that I feel better at the end of the day.
subject: An Extra Hour a Day
verse_text: Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil days.

original_content:
message_id: 1743c301d4bacea0
subject   : Subject: WE ARE NOT RUNNING ALONE (8-30-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 29 Aug 2020 16:47:00 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud*

*of witnesses…let us run with perseverance the*

*race marked out for us. *(Heb. 12:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When you read this verse what is the first thing

you notice? Isn’t it telling us that following God

is not a solo endeavor? *Remember we are not*

*alone!*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
When you read this verse what is the first thing
you notice? Isn’t it telling us that following God
is not a solo endeavor? Remember we are not alone!
original_verse_text: Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses... let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that we are not alone in our journey of faith. Help us to fix our eyes on You, the Author and Perfecter of our faith, and to run the race set before us with perseverance. May we forget what lies behind and strain forward to what lies ahead, pressing on toward the goal of the upward call in Christ Jesus. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may lay aside every weight and sin that clings so closely, and run with endurance the race You have marked out for us. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: When you read this verse, what is the first thing you notice? Isn't it telling us that following God is not a solo endeavor? Remember, we are not alone!
subject: We are Not Running Alone
verse_text: Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses... let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.

original_content:
message_id: 174411d18a3b3cde
subject   : Subject: EXPECT WONDERFUL THINGS (8-31-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 30 Aug 2020 15:44:20 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*I waited patiently for the Lord; He turned to *

*me and **heard my cry. *(Psalm 40:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When You Turn to God. In prayer don’t just

wait Patiently—wait expectantly, knowing

that God will deliver you from whatever pain

or problem you are facing. There is always

hope and alway a response to your cries for

help. *Heavenly Father, b**ecause of You I *

*do not need to worry.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: When You Turn to God. In prayer don’t just wait Patiently-wait expectantly, knowing that God will deliver you from whatever pain or problem you are facing. There is always hope and alway a response to your cries for help. Heavenly Father, because of You I do not need to worry.
original_verse_text: I waited patiently for the Lord; He turned to  me and heard my cry.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, knowing that You hear our cries and are near to the brokenhearted. In times of distress, we wait patiently for Your deliverance, trusting that You will lift us up and guide us through the challenges we face. Lord, You are our refuge and strength, and in You, we find hope and comfort. We praise You for Your unwavering love and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: When You Turn to God. In prayer, don't just wait patiently—wait expectantly, knowing that God will deliver you from whatever pain or problem you are facing. There is always hope and always a response to your cries for help. Heavenly Father, because of You, I do not need to worry.
subject: Expect Wonderful Things
verse_text: I waited patiently for the Lord; He turned to  me and heard my cry.

original_content:
message_id: 1744680e2fcc8cc0
subject   : Subject: A PRAYER FOR SEPTEMBER (9-1-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:51:26 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*A Prayer for September*

(9-1-20)

*Dear Lord! Kind Lord!*

*Gracious Lord I pray*

*Thou wilt look on all I love,*

*Tenderly today!*

*Weed their hearts of weariness;*

*Scatter every care*

*Down a wake of angel-wings*

*Winnowing the air. *

*Bring onto the sorrowing*

*All release from pain;*

*Let the lips of laughter*

*Overflow again;*

*And with all the needy*

*O divide, I pray, *

*This vast measure of content*

*That is mine today!*



James whitcombo Riley 1849—1916
original_reflection_text:
Dear Lord! Kind Lord!

Gracious Lord I pray

Thou wilt look on all I love,

Tenderly today!

Weed their hearts of weariness;

Scatter every care

Down a wake of angel-wings

Winnowing the air.

Bring onto the sorrowing

All release from pain;

Let the lips of laughter

Overflow again;

And with all the needy

O divide, I pray,

This vast measure of content

That is mine today!

James Whitcomb Riley 1849-1916
original_verse_text: Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You are the source of all comfort and peace. As Your children, we cast our anxieties and cares upon You, trusting in Your unfailing love and provision. Lord, we pray that You would weed the hearts of our loved ones of weariness and scatter every care, bringing them the peace that surpasses all understanding. May Your angels' wings bring rest and renewal to the sorrowful, and may the lips of laughter overflow once more. In Your abundant grace, Lord, we ask that You would divide Your vast measure of contentment with all who are in need. We praise You for Your steadfast care and compassion. Amen.
reflection: Dear Lord! Kind Lord! Gracious Lord, I pray, Thou wilt look on all I love, Tenderly today! Weed their hearts of weariness; Scatter every care Down a wake of angel-wings Winnowing the air. Bring to the sorrowing All release from pain; Let the lips of laughter Overflow again; And with all the needy, O, divide, I pray, This vast measure of content That is mine today! James Whitcomb Riley, 1849-1916
subject: A Prayer for September
verse_text: Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.
